title: Swarm Session Tricks & Operational Hacks
description: High-leverage procedural shortcuts developed through forensic experience.

values.name: Timeline Reconstruction
values.rule: Use 'git log --since/--until' to reconstruct the work done during specific time ranges.
values.rationale: Git is the ultimate source of temporal truth for session continuity.
values.example: Using `git log --all -p -- **/boot_report_style.json` to find the lost multi-emoji bootup style.

values.name: The Rule of Three
values.rule: Stop after two identical failures; rethink the approach.
values.rationale: Prevents repetitive loops and preserves session stability.
values.example: After two failed attempts to write a heredoc with complex shell syntax, the agent switched to `write_file`.

values.name: Hot-Swapping Context
values.rule: Update tool instructions within the same PID to maintain state while shifting capabilities.
values.rationale: Allows for dynamic adaptation without the overhead of a full session restart.
values.example: Modifying the `metagit_commit` wrapper's logic during an active commit loop to handle large blobs.
